data.title: Delicious clean and fast food
data.text: Business colleagues shared in fun dinner. The pastrami beef burger, and oh that bun was divine. Beer salad so good w a hint of mint. Don't leave without trying the trio desserts because the chocolate banana brownie, the devils cupcake w fresh cream and strawberry shortcake stack is simply delicious. Busy place even at 9pm. SAN Fernando Ave in Burbank chock full of diverse and worldly options.

data.title: Loved Granville!
data.text:
"Casual gourmet" sums it up. We were a group of 6 and really enjoyed our meal here. The atmosphere was pleasant and the service was perfect. Everyone enjoyed their meals (I had the Uptown Mac & Cheese, which was rich and delicious! Perfectly sized portion.) For starters we shared the Sweet Potato Fries and the Grilled Cheese Dipper, both of which were yummy. The prices are also very reasonable (meal for 6 including wine was only $160, plus tax & tip)

I would definitely return, and completely recommend Granville!

data.title: Great food, GREAT drinks, often confused and untrained servers
data.text:
I avoided Granville for a while, thinking it was a casual family restaurant with pre-fabricated food. I am happy to report that this is not the case. In fact, everything is house-made and i find the food to be fairly honest. They also have a thriving bar scene with a selection of bourbons that is downright impressive. On my last visit, they were out of the house made bitters they use for my favorite drink, the Old Fashioned, but there are plenty of other fish in that sea and the drinks are nice sized and well made.

The problem with Granville is the service. On almost every visit, but especially between shifts like at 3-5pm, the service is spotty to the point of non-existent. The servers are also trained in a style I describe as California Over Share, and the announcing of names and banter are a little off-putting for me. I have had some good and professional servers, but I've had some that were definitely in the wrong business who do things like deliver one dish without the others or without side dishes and who go to other tables to take orders when they should be heading straight to the kitchen when there's a high priority need like a missing sauce or even cutlery. These things would be easily fixed with some good training, but I've had some pretty bad experiences with two plus hour lunches.

That all said, there is some GREAT food on this menu. My personal favorite is the Thai Ginger Salad with
Mango, soba noodles, slaw, avocado, peanut and candied ginger with grilled salmon as my protein choice.The Spring Chicken salad comes with chicken only, but it's wonderful and filling and worth a trip in itself. 

On a recent visit I had the Thick Cut Pork Chop a 12 oz bone-in chop, cajun-rubbed, cran-mango compote, sauteed spinach, yukon russet mashed potatoes which was as good as anywhere i've ever had it, with a thick juicy chop and excellent flavor and proper cooking temperature of just barely pink in the center. The burgers and especially the fries are above average, and there are thin crust artisan pizzas, pastas and an extremely long list of interesting and tasty side dishes available. 

The food is well above average for a place like this. It's fresh and honest and the portions are generous. I like the environment inside with large plants and trees and stacks of firewood along the far wall. I also enjoy the covered outdoor patio at lunch time, complete with bar seating and a lot of tables and banquettes. Frankly, I like it so much, that I am anxious to go whenever can, as long as I feel like I have the time to spare in case I have one of the many slow servers I've had in recent months. I do wish they'd work out their server issues. This would be a five star family restaurant for sure with a little more even service.

data.title: Good but could improve
data.text: We come here often and really like the food. The ciabatta was not as fresh as usual for the Ahi sandwich. Also we sat outside and there was a bit of cigarette smoking maybe from the nearby pool hall. Not Granville's fault . Eat inside if you are bothered by second hand smoke. Yeah for proposition 56!

data.title: Perfectly healthy and satisfying lunch
data.text: Before we flew out of Burbank airport my wife and I stopped in for lunch. She had the Taco Trio and I the Poblano Quinoa with Salmon. Both were fabulous although the chicken in taco 3 was a bit dry. Wait staff was polite and knowledgeable, service quick and prices reasonable. We will be back!

data.title: Great food!
data.text: We ate there several times in July as well as at the one in Studio City. We prefer Burbank due to the lower noise level which is related to the design materials used in construction. The food is great! I can't wait to return. Try the beet salad and the old fashioneds.

data.title: So Good!
data.text: We visited this restaurant with the recommendations from hotel staff. I highly recommend! On San Fernando blvd which is a great street with other great restaurants & shopping. The roasted beets were so good & the grilled cheese dip appetizer. They have several uncommon items on the menu that you don't see anywhere else. Only negative is it is fairly dark so without a flash light on my phone it would of been difficult to read the menu.

data.title: Excellent Menu
data.text: I had dinner with my three daughters and loved it! One teenager is a vegetarian and she was extremely happy with her hummus appetizer and flatbread pizza.  Her younger sister and I both had the salmon which was outstanding.  Try the special mac and cheese-to die for! The menu offers a variety of fresh farm to market meals and decent cocktail list.  Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Great Restaurant- Loved the Sweet Potato Fries!
data.text: We had a large party. All of us loved the food! Good service and the sweet potato fries were the bomb (I don't normally like sweet potatoes or sweet potato fries). My burger was great too! Loved it and I'll be back when I'm in the area.

data.title: A Perfect Cafe for Lunch
data.text:
We were in Burbank at lunchtime and noticed the Granville Cafe. It looked nice from the outside so we decided to give it a try.
This cafe/restaurant is attractive inside, is spacious and comfortable. The service was pleasant, prompt and helpful. The atmosphere was welcoming, not noisy, well lit and clean.

The menu selection was comprehensive and there is a reasonable wine list. The lunches we ordered were tasty and well presented and arrived with no long wait. The prices were very reasonable. We found nothing to criticize about the cafe.

We had a relaxed and enjoyable lunch at Granville Cafe and would be happy to make it our lunch spot in Burbank. Highly recommended!

data.title: GREAT small chain restaurant, less preferred location
data.text: I absolutely love Granville in general - they have great food, consciously sourced, excellent quality mostly organic ingredients and tasty to boot!!  Yet this location takes a back seat to the Glendale and Studio City locations due to a lack of atmosphere and challenging downtown Burbank parking.  So if you're already in the area then go and have a great meal!!

data.title: Always awesome!
data.text: We love Granville!  First time at the Burbank restaurant but have been to Glendale many times. Our waiter, Grant, was great, worked here since opening 8 years ago. Had the skirt steak, tomato bisque and mac&cheese.... all amazing!  Love the decor at this branch. We will be back!

data.title: Horrid on every level!
data.text:
What a completely messed up company!!! I left this location starving after an hour and a half and 3 attempts to cook meat right. The ingredients are not fresh. For instance on this visit we ordered the ahi tuna. The accompanying noodles had carrots that tasted like a freezer bag. I ordered the skirt steak. It was half the size of the photos posted on Yelp, tough as nails, over cooked with cold mashed potatoes, and the saddest salad I've ever seen. The only thing that was missing from the salad was the plastic wrap that was probably over it in the cooler. So I sent it back and asked a burger. I asked for it medium. The server suggested putting it in for medium rare since the cook (as opposed to chef), doesn't know how to cook! I waited a good while and my new burger was completely cold and raw in the middle. Hmm frozen? So now we're waiting on the third attempt. And waiting...and waiting..after 25 min we let them know we are leaving and the manager actually has the audacity to ask what else we ate besides the tuna salad...did we have any drinks he asks? ARE YOU KIDDING? First of all you're the manager. You should know what we ate and drank before speaking with us. Secondly..I'm starving..been at your place for an hour and a half and have still not eaten a thing..and you have the nerve to ask me for anything?? Completely unprofessional from start to leave. I gave him back our gift certificate. 

The only reason I tried them again was because they sent me that gift certificate. Like I wrote in my review of their other location; think Cheesecake Factory meets dumb and dumber. Must be a cheap company. You can see my other review about the filth at their Studio City location.

data.title: Such a great place!
data.text: We absolutely enjoyed our dinner here - the food was delicious, prices were reasonable and our waitress was A-1 over the top helpful!  One of our party ordered a drink that turned out to have no alcohol in it, and the waitress suggested what might help it out and she was totally right!  She couldn't have been more attentive and very helpful in selecting our dinner choices, and paid particular attention to food issues such as lactose intolerant and gluten free choices.  The atmosphere is superb, it is a little noisy the farther in you go, but we were delighted with our patio like table near the street- easy to converse with each other and do a lot of people watching!  Great Great place!  Looking forward to going back!

data.title: Very Good Food
data.text: You can taste the quality in the food. The chicken mac and cheese is just plain awesome and not just for kids. I wish I could find a place like this in my town.

data.title: Exactly what we were looking for!
data.text:
Meeting an old family friend we had not seen in 40 years, and this proved to be just what we needed!
The service was great, the food was tasty, reasonably priced, location was perfect - made for an enjoyable dinner and get together.
We sat outside, just off the sidewalk on a lovely evening, and people watching added to the charm of Granville.

data.title: Good Food: a little pricy- and menu limited
data.text: We ate lunch at this reataraunt based on Trip Advisor Reviews. We ordered a beer, and it was $7.00 for a glass, probably equivalent to one bottle beer - with no larger size available like many places do. The glasses for water were quite small (but they did refill often). My husband's lunch sandwich came with chips with option to purchase a bowl of soup for $3.00. The waitress told him that since he was purchasing soup, he didnt get chips. The food itself was pretty good. Overall, I would say it's a GOOD restaurant but not GREAT.

data.title: Love the open-air area in the front
data.text:
While walking around downtown Burbank we stopped here to eat because it had a varied menu and seemed to be popular. There was a 20 minute wait, but they asked for a phone number so they could text us when our table was ready. This allowed us to keep walking while we waited. The wait ended up being less than the estimated 20 minutes. 

They offer a lot of non-gmo and natural, healthy options which wasn't important to us, but would be to a lot of people. I had a burger and fries which was OK. The burger was very thick, but pretty dry. The fries were good but nothing special. My husband had a turkey sandwich and chips which again was good but not exceptional. 

Our server was very good, but went on break while we were waiting for our food. The food took quite a while because they apparently prepare everything fresh after you order it. 

We sat in the area in the front of the restaurant which is open-air with a view of the street outside. The weather was perfect so this was a nice option. Would probably try something different though if we ever returned to the area.

data.title: casual, healthy, super fresh, delightful flavors and most satisfying
data.text: This is the perfect spot and my favorite so far in Burbank, CA.  They boast their food items are made from 'scratch' and indeed, they use fresh produce and herbs.  We had outstanding sandwiches with nice, and unusually treated sides such as Greek salad, seasoned french fries.  If you love bacon, this is a must do as they have crisp sweet non fatty bacon in the turkey and chicken sandwich with your choice of breads.  This place is popular and does not take reservations so either go early or expect to wait for a while.  There are a few sidewalk tables and indoor tables and a full bar.  Our only criticism is the  cocktails are weak, minimalistic and cost about $10.  Other than that, it was a great, fresh and light meal.

data.title: Best trout ever
data.text: I was staying up the street and wandering down thru Burbank which is one of my favorite downtowns .... And passed Granville ....it looked like a fun place...so glad I decided to stop in .  The bar staff Ryan and Kat were über friendly and made great recommendations.  I had the trout and vegetables ...everything fresh and light....a great dining experience
